article_title: Fitch Maintains Cigna on Rating Watch Negative

article_metadata.description: Fitch Ratings has maintained the Rating Watch Negative for Cigna Corporation's (Cigna) 'A-' Issuer Default Rating (IDR), 'BBB+' senior unsecured notes

twitter.description: Fitch Ratings has maintained the Rating Watch Negative for Cigna Corporation's (Cigna) 'A-' Issuer Default Rating (IDR), 'BBB+' senior unsecured notes
twitter.title: Fitch Maintains Cigna on Rating Watch Negative

article_summary:
Fitch would likely remove Cigna from Rating Watch Negative and affirm Cigna's ratings if the Cigna-Anthem merger failed to close.
CHICAGO--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Fitch Ratings has maintained the Rating Watch Negative for Cigna Corporation's (Cigna) 'A-' Issuer Default Rating (IDR), 'BBB+' senior unsecured notes and the 'A+' Insurer Financial Strength (IFS) ratings of certain subsidiaries.
RATING SENSITIVITIESFitch plans to resolve the Rating Watch upon the close of the acquisition.
Key considerations factored into Cigna's Rating Watch include typical merger-related issues such as the potential operational and earnings disruptions that could arise during the integration of both companies.
Excluding the ratings-negative aspects of that planned acquisition, Fitch believes that today's review would have resulted in the affirmation of Cigna's ratings with Stable Outlooks.
